name: Mercer Frey

aspects.high_concept: Guild Master of the Thieves Guild (Secret Traitor)
aspects.trouble: Corrupted by the Skeleton Key's Power

stunts: Skeleton Key Mastery: +2 to Burglary when opening any lock (bypasses magical locks)
Master Infiltrator: Once per scene, automatically succeed at a Stealth roll to enter a location undetected
Betrayer's Strike: +2 to Attack when target is unaware or trusts Mercer
notes: Mercer Frey is the current Guild Master of the Thieves Guild, a Breton master thief with unparalleled skill. Unknown to the guild, he murdered his predecessor Gallus and framed Karliah, stealing the Skeleton Key from the Twilight Sepulcher. He has been embezzling from the guild's treasury for years, using the Skeleton Key to rob the guild blind. His betrayal has caused the guild's decline and the loss of Nocturnal's favor. He is cunning, ruthless, and will stop at nothing to protect his secrets.
combat_tactics: Mercer fights dirty, using ambush tactics, poison, and the environment to his advantage. He prefers to strike from shadows and retreat when outmatched. In his final confrontation, he uses the Skeleton Key's power to manipulate locks and traps.
social_interaction: Mercer is cold, professional, and maintains strict control over guild operations. He speaks with authority and expects immediate obedience. While outwardly loyal to the guild, he subtly manipulates members and information to serve his own interests. He is suspicious of outsiders and watches new recruits closely.

relationships.Karliah: Framed for murder, hunted as traitor

personality_notes.speaking_style: Clipped, authoritative, businesslike. No warmth or humor.
personality_notes.character_growth: N/A - Mercer is committed to his betrayal and cannot be redeemed

story_hooks: Assigns major heists to prove loyalty and test capabilities
Secretly investigates anyone who questions him
Eventually sends party into trap at Snow Veil Sanctum
Final confrontation at Irkngthand as truth is revealed
Possesses Skeleton Key - ultimate guild betrayal

dialogue_samples.greeting: You must be the new recruit Brynjolf mentioned. We'll see if you're worth the trouble.
dialogue_samples.assignment: I need this handled quietly and professionally. No mistakes, no witnesses, no questions.
dialogue_samples.suspicion: I don't trust easily, and I don't tolerate failure. Remember that.
dialogue_samples.final_confrontation: You should have stayed out of this. The guild was mine to control, and now you've ruined everything!
